questions: What must be installed when using react-router?
What is the most current version of react-router?
Where can react router dependencies be found within a React app?
answer: Within the package.json or package-lock.json files.

questions: True or False: react-router @6 uses switch statements?
True or False: react-router @5.3 uses switch statements?
What is used instead of a switch statement when setting up react routes?
True or False: any component placed above a switch statement will be see as global, and will render on every component?
True or False: react-router @5.3 uses element={} instead of component={} within the component route?
answer: False. This is only used by react-router-dom@6.

questions: What is the use of path='' within route?
answer: It is used to connect the desired path of the component. The given path will be used within route linking.

questions: True or False: Route is comparable to href in HTML?
True of False: the path within a component does not correspond to the path found within the corresponding component URL?
answer: False. The path set within the route is the path that is linked to the component, and therefore will be the same within the URL.

questions: Are routes to establish components self closing?
Is <BrowserRouter> or <Router> proper syntax when setting up the routes?
True or False: within react-router-dom@6, the component name is placed within the element tag?
answer: True. The component name is then placed within its own self closing tag.

questions: Which is more versatile, <Link> or <NavLink>?
What can <NavLink> do, that <Link> can not do?
answer: NavLink can be used to add style attributes directly to the active routes.

questions: True or False: <Link> or <NavLink> work outside of a router?
What is the difference between BrowserRouter and Router?
answer: A <BrowserRouter> uses regular URL paths, and a <Router> does not.

questions: What is the purpose of the to={} or to='' attribute within <NavLink> or <Link>?
answer: It will tell the link where the path should lead to. It will reference the original path that is set within the routes component path.

questions: True or False: App.js is most commonly used for storing the component routes?
True or False: in order for <Link> or <NavLink> to work, the paths much be identical to the component route paths?
Does the hierarchy of the route affect how it is displayed on the page?
answer: Yes, the routes must be place sequentially in order for the components to properly render on the page.
